title: [WIP] Add geode-python crate to expose geodb-core features
body:
Create geodb-python crate to expose geodb-core functionality to Python

This PR adds a new Python binding crate `geodb-python` alongside the existing `geodb-wasm` crate, providing Python users access to all geodb-core features.

## Plan:
- [x] Explore repository structure and understand existing code
- [x] Build and test current codebase
- [x] Add PyO3 dependency to workspace
- [x] Create geodb-python crate directory structure
- [x] Set up Cargo.toml for geodb-python with PyO3
- [x] Implement Python module with core functionality:
  - [x] Database initialization
  - [x] Country queries (by ISO2, phone code, etc.)
  - [x] State/region queries
  - [x] City queries
  - [x] Smart search functionality
  - [x] Statistics
- [x] Update workspace Cargo.toml to include geodb-python
- [x] Add Python bindings test (if infrastructure exists)
- [x] Build and test geodb-python crate
- [x] Update README to document geodb-python usage

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT SUFFIX -->



<details>

<summary>Original prompt</summary>

> Make the geode-python crate in addition to geodb-wasm, which will create the pythonmodule, exposing all the geodb-core features and functionalities for python


</details>

title: Add comprehensive README.md
body:
The repository lacked documentation. Added comprehensive README.md covering project capabilities, API usage, and contribution guidelines.

## Changes

- **README.md**: 358-line documentation covering:
  - Project overview with 10 key features (caching, filtering, aliases, phone codes, timezone support, WASM bindings)
  - Installation for `geodb-core` and `geodb-wasm` crates
  - API reference for `GeoDb`, `Country`, `State`, `City` types
  - Usage examples: basic queries, filtering, phone code search, city lookup
  - Data sources (countries, states, cities, aliases)
  - Contributing guidelines and development setup

- **.gitignore**: Standard Rust patterns to exclude `target/` and IDE files

## Example Usage

```rust
use geodb_core::prelude::*;

let db = GeoDb::<StandardBackend>::load()?;

// Find country and access metadata
if let Some(country) = db.find_country_by_iso2("US") {
    println!("{}: {}", country.name(), country.phone_code());
}

// Filter by region and currency
let euro_countries: Vec<_> = db.countries()
    .iter()
    .filter(|c| c.region() == "Europe" && c.currency() == "EUR")
    .collect();
```

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT SUFFIX -->



<details>

<summary>Original prompt</summary>

> Create a comprehensive README.md file for the repository. Include sections for project description, features, installation, usage examples, contributing, and license. Base the content on the repository's description: 'The Rust based GeoDB, offering caching and filtering, having extensive data and Aliases for the names'. Ensure the README is well-structured and informative. The project is a Rust library for geographic database operations with caching, filtering, and name aliases.


</details>
